thread.title: Rangers notes: Dylan McIlrath inserted into the lineup for Dan Boyle - Hockey
thread.title_full: Rangers notes: Dylan McIlrath inserted into the lineup for Dan Boyle - Hockey - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: Rangers notes: Dylan McIlrath inserted into the lineup for Dan Boyle - Hockey
text:
Long time 
Defenseman Dan Boyle, in the second season of a two-year, $9 million deal, was a healthy scratch for the first time as a Ranger as coach Alain Vigneault inserted rookie Dylan McIlrath.
In fact, it was the first time Boyle, 39, had been scratched from a game for a reason other than injury since he missed a game on Nov. 11, 2008 in his first season with the Sharks to attend the birth of his child.
"He hasn’t been as good as he was last year in the playoffs with that first pass," Vigneault said of Boyle, who had one assist — on the power play — in three games.
McIlrath, paired with Keith Yandle, logged 12:20 with two shots — including a blast on his first shift that Jets goalie Michael Hutchinson barely got his blocker on — and one blocked shot.
"Yeah, he didn’t play a lot of minutes because of all the special teams but I thought, for the most part, he played all right," Vigneault said.
Highlight save 
On the one-to-ridiculous scale, it wasn’t quite as good as his diving paddle stop on Ryan Johansen in Saturday’s 5-2 win over the Blue Jackets but Henrik Lundqvist still provided one for the highlight reel against the Jets.
Caught out of position at 10:34 of the first period when the puck took a long bounce off the backboards to Alexander Burmistrov, heading for the crease, Lundqvist dove into position to stop the shot. 
Briefs 
Defensemen Marc Staal and Dan Girardi both escaped hand injuries, Staal when he was hit by Adam Pardy’s stick and Girardi on Blake Wheeler’s check. … Forwards Jesper Fast and Emerson Etem remained the healthy scratches. Etem, acquired in the off-season from the Ducks, has yet to make his Rangers’ debut.
— Andrew Gross
